intro: Micromeria satureioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky areas. It has a low-growing habit and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Micromeria satureioides is often found in open habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
